;华尔街周四再次下跌，因为投资者消化了一系列好坏参半的季度收益和美国经济数据显示出的弹性迹象，可能会鼓励美联储将利率维持在限制性水平的时间比预期更长。

;

;美国三大股指均呈红色。以科技股为主的纳斯达克指数跌幅最大，在盈利指引不明朗和“长期走高”的利率情景下，受到对利率敏感的动量股的拖累。

;

;纽约证券交易所 FANG+ 动量股指数;(.NYFANG); 最后下跌 2.3%。

;

;全部三个指数已经设定了每周下跌的路线。

;

;“我们看到大量公司盈利未达到投资者预期的压力，特别是来自那些业绩强劲的公司纽约 AXS Investments 首席执行官格雷格·巴苏克 (Greg Bassuk) 表示：“今年早些时候，我们看到了股市的实力和股市。”标准普尔 500 指数中有三分之一的公司将于本周公布业绩。

;

;乍一看，大约五分之四的公司盈利超出预期。根据伦敦证券交易所 (LSEG) 的数据，分析师的最新预测显示，标准普尔 500 指数的总盈利将同比增长 2.6%。

;

;一系列强劲数据包括 4.9% 的季度年化;第三季度GDP跃升;，为近两年来最强劲的数据，加剧了投资者对美联储限制性措施的担忧巴苏克补充道，投资者“通过激进的美联储的视角来消化经济数据……这挑战了美联储将在 2024 年开始降息的观念”。

;< p>;“具有讽刺意味的是，虽然数据强劲，但它们加剧了投资者对美联储在利率方面长期保持较高水平的担忧。”

;

;美国参议院周四以压倒性多数否决了迫使总统乔·拜登从西非国家尼日尔撤军的立法军官于 7 月夺取政权的国家。

;

;该措施以 86 票对 11 票否决。

;

;美国 ;本月正式宣布;尼日尔发生军事政变，导致正式暂停援助，但美国官员表示没有计划改变美国在该国的驻军。

;

;尼日尔一直是华盛顿打击伊斯兰叛乱分子的合作伙伴，这些叛乱分子在非洲杀害了数千人，并使数百万人流离失所。该国大约有 1,000 名国防部人员。

;

;发起这项立法的共和党参议员兰德·保罗 (Rand Paul) 认为，未经国会批准，军队部署不当，并表示美国人不应该面临被抓的风险

;

;“中东战火纷飞，在尼日尔驻军1000多人有什么意义？在一个被统治的国家驻扎1000多人有意义吗？”是由军政府实施的吗？”保罗在参议院演讲中说道。

;

;参议院外交关系委员会民主党主席、参议员本·卡丁表示，如果美国人撤军，可能会留下一个真空，而俄罗斯或其合作伙伴瓦格纳雇佣兵可能会填补这一真空。

;

;“我们没有对世界的那部分给予足够的重视。我们当然不想表明我们正在放弃世界的那部分，”卡丁说。

;

;在过去十年中，美国军队对尼日尔军队进行了反恐训练，并运营了两个军事基地，其中一个军事基地负责针对伊斯兰国和基地组织在该地区的分支机构执行无人机任务。

;对从埃及进入加沙的拉法过境点的卡车进行过于严格的检查，导致人道主义援助的流动速度减慢为“点滴” “随着巴勒斯坦人的饥饿日益严重，联合国世界粮食计划署（粮食计划署）执行主任辛迪·麦凯恩周四告诉路透社。

;

;;拉法口岸;，由埃及控制，不与以色列接壤，已成为自以色列对加沙实施“全面围困”以来的援助交付;为了报复;哈马斯武装分子 10 月 7 日从沿海地带发动的袭击。

;

;美国正在主导与以色列、埃及和联合国的谈判，试图创造一个持续的交付对加沙的援助机制。他们正在就边境加沙一侧的援助和轰炸检查程序争论不休。

;

;“我们已经收到了一些——一点点，只是一点点——卡车进来，”麦凯恩在接受采访时说。 “我们需要大量物资进入。我们需要安全、不受限制地进入加沙，以便我们能够提供食物并确保人们不会饿死，因为这就是正在发生的事情。”

;

; ;有限运送;食物、水和自周六以来，不允许燃料进入。以色列担心哈马斯可能转移燃料供应。

;

;粮食计划署的三辆卡车载有约 60 吨食物 - 足以养活 20 万人一天 -周六进入加沙。据该机构称，此后又有一辆粮食计划署卡车通过。

;

;巴勒斯坦红新月会周四表示，已收到 74 辆援助卡车。

;

;麦凯恩访问了埃及并会见了官员们表示，每辆卡车都必须在检查站卸下货物进行检查，然后在检查完成后重新装载。

;

;“官僚主义太疯狂了，”麦凯恩说，并补充说，虽然她理解需要检查为了确保武器和弹药不被走私，应该更容易获得食物。

;

;埃及政府没有立即回应置评请求。

;

;美国官员，美国国务院发言人马修·米勒周四对记者表示，包括在该地区的特使大卫·萨特菲尔德正在努力改进这一程序。

;

;“我们需要加快检查制度，我们正在努力”米勒说。

;

;麦凯恩表示，世界粮食计划署需要筹集 1 亿美元，以便在今年年底之前为加沙超过 100 万人提供粮食，因为多种原因造成了人道主义援助融资危机。世界各地的紧急情况、俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争导致粮食价格上涨以及麦凯恩所说的“捐助疲劳”。

;

;在华盛顿与美国官员和立法者会面时，麦凯恩表示，她听到了人们对援助可能会受到影响的担忧。被哈马斯武装分子转移，但粮食署表示，粮食计划署拥有适当的系统，以确保援助到达需要的人手中。

;

;“这是一个战区。事情即将发生。所以我不能百分百地说没有任何东西会落入坏人手中。但我们将尽一切努力确保它不会出现。”她说。

;;新当选的众议院议长迈克·约翰逊 (R-LA) 在当选新任议长后向美国众议院发表讲话2023 年 10 月 25 日，美国华盛顿美国国会大厦。路透社/伊丽莎白·弗兰茨;
;

;新任美国众议院议长迈克·约翰逊 (Mike Johnson) 与他的保守派共和党同事一起投票反对堕胎和堕胎。性婚姻，但最受关注的是他为推翻唐纳德·特朗普 2020 年大选失败所做的努力。

;

;他的新角色使他在众议院拥有巨大的影响力，并与民主党总统乔·拜登和特朗普一起在谈判桌上占有一席之地。参议院民主党领袖查克·舒默正在谈判各种法案。但在国会去年采取行动后，他几乎没有能力干预 2024 年总统选举，除非他拒绝遵守法律。

;

;自周三赢得议长木槌以来，这位 51 岁的总统路易斯安那州议员拒绝评论他在 2020 年大选后与前总统特朗普的合作，也拒绝透露他是否相信拜登合法获胜。

;

;尽管他和 199 名同事投票反对 ;2022 年选举计数改革法案;，该法案捆绑在年底支出法案中，该立法将使立法者除了正式接受结果之外采取任何行动都变得更加困难。

;

;作为对 2021 年 1 月 6 日混乱的回应而通过的两党法律，需要众议院五分之一的批准和参议院考虑对一个州的结果提出质疑——这个门槛比以前高得多，当时每个议院的任何一位立法者都有能力发起挑战。

;

;“如果遵循的话，我们应该加入俄亥俄州立大学选举法专家爱德华·弗利 (Edward Foley) 表示：“形状良好，人们应该期望它会得到遵循。”

;

;民主党团体抨击约翰逊在法律工作中倡导保守派2016 年当选众议院议员之前，他一直致力于社会事业。

;

;2013 年，他针对两起诉讼为该州禁止同性婚姻的禁令辩护，两年后美国最高法院在全国范围内将同性婚姻合法化，诉讼结束。< /p>;

;他还在针对肯塔基州的宗教歧视诉讼中代表圣经主题公园，并反对法院推翻同性恋定罪法律的裁决。

;

;在国会，约翰逊投票支持如果最高法院推翻他的决定，他的大多数共和党同僚都反对在全国范围内使堕胎合法化并为同性婚姻提供一些保护的立法。

;

;他投票反对 9 月份的一项临时拨款法案，该法案以微弱优势避免了部分政府的组建尽管他后来表示，他现在计划在 11 月 17 日即将到来的下一个融资截止日期之前支持一项政府关门。

;

;特朗普失败后，约翰逊起草了一份法律简报，并由其他 125 名众议院共和党人签署，试图说服最高法院驳回特朗普输给拜登的几个有争议州的选举结果。

;

;约翰逊辩称​​，选举并未受到广泛的选民欺诈的影响，因为特朗普和他的许多盟友错误地声称，但相反，特朗普输掉的一些州在 COVID-19 大流行期间非法改变了选举程序，导致这些州的结果无效。

;

;即使在最高法院驳回此案后，约翰逊仍坚持这些论点

;

;约翰逊在一份由其他 36 名众议院共和党议员签署并于 2021 年 1 月 6 日发布的声明中写道：“我们确信某些州的选举法以违宪的方式进行了修改。”一群特朗普支持者冲进美国国会大厦，试图破坏选举认证，但失败了。

;

;几个小时后，约翰逊和其他 138 名众议院共和党人投票反对认证拜登的胜利。

;

;约翰逊可以如果共和党人保留众议院的控制权并让他继续担任议长，那么他将在 2025 年 1 月国会开会确认明年总统竞选的结果时处于更加突出的位置。

;

;即便如此，他也几乎没有什么机会影响结果的能力。两党政策中心的选举法专家迈克尔·托宁表示：“议长在选举团过程中的作用非常有限，几乎不存在。”该法律还明确规定，副总统仅扮演仪式性角色。福利表示，从理论上讲，众议院议长可以拒绝遵守法律，甚至可以宣布自己为代理总统。如果没有候选人赢得多数选举人票，众议院议长也有能力影响程序，必须宣布获胜者。

;

;“这感觉不现实，但 2021 年 1 月 6 日发生的事情，在这件事发生之前，他也感到不切实际，”他说。

;;以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡在周三（10 月 25 日）的电视声明中表示，以色列正在准备对加沙进行地面入侵，但他拒绝提供有关行动时间或其他信息的任何细节。;
; ;
;;以色列10 月 26 日，装甲车在加沙地带北部某个地点参加行动。通过以色列国防军;
;

;以色列军队夜间对加沙发动了 20 天内最大规模的地面攻击- 由于以色列对被围困的巴勒斯坦领土进行无情轰炸，阿拉伯世界的愤怒日益高涨，与哈马斯之间的战争愈演愈烈。

;

;总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡曾表示，以色列军队仍在为全面地面入侵做准备，而美国和其他国家敦促以色列推迟行动，担心这可能会引发中东其他战线的敌对行动。

;

;向加沙巴勒斯坦平民提供援助的联合国机构表示，如果没有燃料到达哈马斯，它可能很快就不得不停止行动- 迫切需要住所、水、食物和医疗服务的统治领土。

;

;10 月 7 日哈马斯袭击以色列社区后，以色列轰炸了人口稠密的加沙地带。以色列称哈马斯杀害了约 1,400 人，其中包括儿童，并劫持了 200 多名人质，其中一些是婴儿和老年人。

;

;加沙卫生部周四表示，7,028 名巴勒斯坦人在报复性空袭中丧生，其中包括2,913名儿童。

;

;美国国务院表示，华盛顿知道加沙有大量人员死亡，但没有独立确认数字，也不相信哈马斯公布的数字。

;

; >;

;以色列军方也表示哈马斯的数据不可信，但没有提供自己的评估。加沙卫生部发言人阿什拉夫·齐德拉（Ashraf al-Qidra）拒绝了质疑这些数字的声明。

;

;该部周四发布了一份文件，称其中包含所有已确认身份的受害者的姓名及其身份证号码。

;

; >;

;以色列陆军电台称，军方一夜之间对加沙北部发动了本次战争中最大规模的入侵。一段军事视频显示，装甲车越过戒备森严的边界，炸毁了建筑物。

;

;“坦克和步兵袭击了许多恐怖组织、基础设施和反坦克导弹发射站，”它说。

;< p>;巴勒斯坦人表示，以色列连夜再次空袭该领土，加沙中部地区的人们报告整晚都遭受了密集的坦克炮击。

;

;;2023-10-26T18:05:55Z;
;

;Former lawmaker Maria Corina Machado was formally declared the victor of the Venezuelan opposition's weekend presidential primary on Thursday, as a government official warned foreign diplomats not to interfere in the electoral process.

;

;The country's attorney general said on Wednesday his office has launched ;a criminal investigation; into the primary and members of its organizing commission.

;

;The investigation risks the wrath of the US, which last week ;relaxed some sanctions; on the government of President Nicolas Maduro on pledges his government made of a fair election next year, in a deal between it and the opposition ;in Barbados.;

;

;The US State Department has already said it will reinstate previous sanctions if Maduro's government does not rescind public office bans on Machado and others, as well as release political prisoners and "wrongly detained" Americans by the end of November.

;

;Sanctions were widely expanded in 2019 after Maduro won re-election in what the US and others say was a fraudulent vote.

;

;Machado, who won about 93% of votes in the primary, met with about 10 foreign diplomats on Wednesday at her party's headquarters, sparking the government's objections.

;

;"With all due respect...don't interfere with internal issues," Jorge Rodriguez, president of the ruling party-run legislature, told a large group of diplomats at his own meeting with them on Thursday, as reporters looked on.

;

;The government did not provide a list of attendees at the meeting.

;

;Rodriguez, the government's top negotiator in talks with the opposition, told the diplomats the primary violated electoral rules because it was organized without the help of electoral authorities and violated the Barbados deal.

;

;Machado, however, said the investigation into the primary is a "clear" violation of the Barbados deal.

;

;"We hope it does not proceed," she said at a press conference to announce the primary's final vote count.

;

;The primary's organizing commission ;tried unsuccessfully; to involve electoral authorities, said commission head Jesus Maria Casal, who is among those under investigation.

;

;He did not comment on the investigation.

;;2023-10-26T18:10:27Z;
;

;New findings that US Supreme Court ;Justice Clarence Thomas; apparently failed to repay at least a "significant portion" of a $267,230 loan he received from a wealthy benefactor prompted Senate Democrats on Thursday to step up their criticism of the court's lack of an ;ethics code;.

;

;A personal loan that Thomas received in 1999 from longtime friend Anthony Welters to buy a Prevost Marathon motor coach was forgiven before the principal was fully repaid, according to a report by Senate Democrats on Wednesday based on a review of loan documents provided by Welters.

;

;"With each new report, the American people realize how many lavish, undisclosed gifts Justice Thomas has received from his gaggle of fawning billionaires," Democratic Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Dick Durbin wrote on Thursday in a social media post.

;

;Durbin said the "undisclosed, forgiven" loan demonstrates the need for a binding code of conduct for the court.

;

;Thomas, part of the court's 6-3 conservative majority, has been a focal point of criticism by Democrats amid revelations this year involving some of the justices concerning hobnobbing with the rich and powerful, private jet trips, luxury vacations and real estate transactions.

;

;The latest matter involving the luxury motor coach was scrutinized by Democrats on the Senate Finance Committee after the New York Times published an article on the loan in August.

;

;The committee released its findings on Wednesday, concluding that none of the documents indicated that Thomas "ever made payments to Welters in excess of the annual interest on the loan." The documents showed that Welters forgave the loan in 2008, according to the findings.

;

;Finance Committee Chair Ron Wyden called on Thomas to explain "exactly how much debt was forgiven" and whether he reported any loan forgiveness on his tax returns and paid all taxes he owed. The findings also noted that Thomas did not report the "forgiven debt" on his 2008 financial disclosure forms, which require the inclusion of any "discharge of indebtedness" as income.

;

;In a statement, Thomas's attorney Elliot Berke said, "The loan was never forgiven. Any suggestion to the contrary is false. The Thomases made all payments to Mr. Welters on a regular basis until the terms of the agreement were satisfied in full." Berke did not answer further questions as to whether the principal of the loan was paid in full.

;

;The Senate Judiciary Committee in July approved a Democratic-backed bill that would mandate a binding ethics code for the justices. Given Republican opposition, the bill has little chance of becoming law.

;

;Thomas and Welters did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

;

;Unlike other members of the federal judiciary, the life-tenured justices have no binding code of conduct, though they are subject to certain financial disclosure laws.

;

;The news outlet ProPublica reported this year on Thomas's failure to disclose luxury trips and real estate transactions involving Texas businessman Harlan Crow.

;

;Thomas previously defended his omission of the Crow-funded luxury trips from his disclosure forms by saying he believed they were "personal hospitality" and thus exempt from disclosure requirements, and called his nondisclosure of the real estate transaction inadvertent.

;

;Steven Lubet, a legal ethics expert who teaches law at Northwestern University, said Thomas's failure to disclose the motor coach loan "is more significant than the past failures."

;

;"There isn't even a plausible excuse this time," Lubet said. "The directions could not be more clear. It's a quarter of a million dollars - it's hard to attribute that to inadvertence."

;

;"Thomas's votes can send someone to prison for life or financially destroy them for breaking the law," added Stephen Gillers, a legal ethics expert who teaches law at New York University. "Yet he repeatedly breaks the law, confident that he is immune to consequences."

;

;Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of the now-bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX, testified in his fraud trial on Thursday without the jury present so the judge overseeing the case can first decide what portions of his testimony are admissible.

;

;US District Judge Lewis Kaplan's decision came after prosecutors finished presenting their case accusing Bankman-Fried of stealing billions of dollars from customers and the defense presented its first two witnesses.

;

;The judge released the jury for the rest of the day following a lunch break. Bankman-Fried briefly sat at the witness stand before the trial resumed, then returned to the defense table.

;

;The prosecution rested its case after presenting 12 days of testimony in federal court in Manhattan in which former close FTX colleagues told the jury he directed them to divert customer funds to his hedge fund and lie to investors and lenders. Bankman-Fried's risky decision ;testify; gives prosecutors the chance to cross-examine the 31-year-old former billionaire about those claims that he told colleagues to commit crimes.

;

;Bankman-Fried was called to the stand after the defense presented its first two witnesses: Krystal Rolle, Bankman-Fried's lawyer in the Bahamas; and database expert Joseph Pimbley.

;

;Bankman-Fried has pleaded not guilty to two counts of fraud and five counts of conspiracy. If convicted, he could ;face decades; in prison. Prosecutors have said Bankman-Fried used the misappropriated funds to prop up his crypto-focused hedge fund, Alameda Research, make speculative venture investments and ;donate more than $100 million; to US political campaigns.

;

;His lawyers have said three of his former colleagues, who have pleaded guilty and agreed to cooperate with prosecutors, tailored their testimony to implicate Bankman-Fried in the hopes of receiving lenient sentences.

;

;Defense lawyer Mark Cohen said Bankman-Fried's direct testimony could last close to five hours, before prosecutors get a chance to cross-examine him.

;

;After the prosecution rested its case, US District Judge Lewis Kaplan denied a defense request to acquit Bankman-Fried before the case goes to the jury. Cohen argued that prosecutors had not set forth "viable legal theories" of wire fraud, which prosecutor Nicolas Roos disputed.

;

;The final prosecution witness, FBI agent Marc Troiano, testified about Bankman-Fried's use of the encrpyted messaging application Signal when the trial resumed on Thursday morning after a week-long break.

;

;Troiano said Signal groups that Bankman-Fried was in with colleagues often were set to delete messages automatically, as jurors saw screenshots from a phone belonging to Caroline Ellison, the former chief executive of Bankman-Fried's Alameda Research hedge fund and his on-and-off girlfriend.

;

;Ellison previously ;testified; that Bankman-Fried directed employees to "be careful with what we put in writing, and not put into writing something that could get us into legal trouble."

;

;Bankman-Fried has maintained that while he ;made mistakes; running FTX, he never intended to steal funds.

;

;Legal experts have said Bankman-Fried has ;little to lose; by bucking conventional wisdom and testifying, given weeks of the testimony against him by insiders painting an unflattering portrait of his character.

;

;Rolle, the first defense witness, testified that the day after FTX declared bankruptcy on Nov. 11, 2022, authorities in the Bahamas - where FTX was based - directed Bankman-Fried to hand over remaining assets to regulators in the Caribbean country.

;

;The defense could argue that Rolle's account undercuts prosecution testimony from Gary Wang, FTX's former chief technology officer, that Bankman-Fried told him he transferred assets to the Bahamas because "they seemed more likely to let him stay in control of the company, compared to the US"

;

;Pimbley, the second defense witness, testified that most FTX customers had a type of account that allowed their funds to be lent to other users. Bankman-Fried's lawyers could argue that shows that Alameda's use of FTX customer funds was not improper.

;

;The judge at several points urged prosecutor Thane Rehn to speed up his cross-examination of Pimbley, at one point alluding to being tasked with measuring smoked fish while working at his father's deli as a child.

;

;"It means pastrami is not included, neither is coleslaw or macaroni salad," Kaplan said.

;

;Kaplan said some of Bankman-Fried's testimony would take place outside the jury's presence so he can decide whether it is admissible as evidence. That would include any testimony about the involvement of FTX lawyers in structuring loans from Alameda to FTX executives, which prosecutors have said was a key way the defendant and others took funds from unwitting customers.

;

;Prosecutors have said Alameda looted FTX funds through special trading privileges on the exchange. They may ask Bankman-Fried during cross-examination about why he did not disclose Alameda's privileges to FTX customers or equity investors, and why he posted on social media in the midst of a wave of customer withdrawals last November that FTX was "fine" when he knew it was short billions of dollars in funds.

;这座平时熙熙攘攘的城市，坐落在保龄球馆的银行周四早上，安德罗斯科金河异常安静，学校和企业关闭，大多数居民在警方搜寻嫌疑人时遵守就地避难令。

;

;警方封锁了通往枪击现场的道路、保龄球馆和酒吧。身着防弹背心、携带自动步枪的安全人员守卫着镇上缅因州中央医疗中心医院的入口，许多枪击受害者都被送往该医院。

;

;阿塞林说，当他第一次听说此事时，他的心沉了下去。周三晚上发生了枪击事件，他很想知道自己是否认识受害者。他说，他看到警车冲向即时休闲保龄球馆的方向，救护车则从另一条路飞回医院。

;

;“那些人只是出去玩得开心。其他居民表示，过去几十年来，刘易斯顿因去工业化而陷入经济困境，习惯了小规模犯罪和打斗，但枪击事件将其带入了新的境地。 ” 和痛苦的现实。

;

;“我们以前从来不用担心像这样被枪杀，”55 岁的小罗杰·卢西尔 (Roger Lussier Jr.) 说，他是刘易斯顿的另一位终身居民。他住着。

;

;“这不再是一个安全的社区。现在我们就像你读到的所有其他地方一样。”

;

;另一位不愿透露姓名的居民，说他周三晚上一直在保龄球馆附近帮助妹妹准备驾驶考试，街道上突然挤满了警车、警报器和全副武装的特工。

;

;“这太疯狂了，”他说。 “当然，我们会在街角商店外打架或其他什么地方，但从来没有发生过这样的事情。”

;

;缅因州州长珍妮特·米尔斯在新闻发布会上表示，枪击事件损害了缅因州作为美国最安全州之一的声誉。

;

;“这次袭击袭击了我们是谁以及我们所珍视的价值观的核心，”她说，并补充说她曾在刘易斯顿生活和工作，在那里遇见了她的丈夫并抚养了她的孩子.

;

;“这座城市不值得对其公民、心灵的平静和安全感进行如此可怕的攻击，”她说。 “没有任何言语可以真实或充分地衡量缅因州人民的悲伤。”

;周四，一名联邦法官命令佐治亚州议员为 2024 年选举绘制新的国会地图，裁定现任共和党人支持的计划非法稀释了黑人选票，违反了《投票权法》。

;

;美国选区史蒂夫·琼斯要求立法者在 12 月 8 日之前制定一份新地图，其中包括一个黑人占多数或接近多数的额外选区，这可能会将共和党席位让给民主党。

;

;共和党在 2022 年选举中赢得了该州 14 个美国众议院选区中的 9 个选区，这次选举是在琼斯宣布无效的地图上进行的。

;< p>;该诉讼是美国各地;多起选区重新划分案件;之一这可能有助于确定哪个政党在明年的国会选举中控制众议院。民主党只需在全国范围内增加 5 个席位，即可夺回他们在 2022 年失去的众议院多数席位。

;

;佐治亚州的裁决是在 ;美国最高法院裁定;阿拉巴马州共和党绘制的地图非法伤害黑人选民。此后，联邦法官小组;批准了一张新地图< /a>; 在该州唯一的黑人占多数的选区中增加了一个接近多数黑人的选区。

;

;琼斯还命令立法者重新划定该州的一些立法选区。

;

;在在一份长达 516 页的裁决书中，法官指出，过去十年来，该州的人口增长完全归功于其少数民族居民。尽管如此，他说，该州的国会和立法地图并没有增加更多黑人占多数的选区。

;

;尽管几十年来在为黑人选民提供更多机会方面取得了“巨大进步”，琼斯写道，“政治进程正在恶化”。对黑人选民并不同样开放。”

;

;周三，亲属们在巴黎向媒体发表讲话，;罗马;，他们还会见了总理乔治亚·梅洛尼。周四，另一个团体在马德里接受媒体采访，并会见了西班牙外交部长何塞·曼努埃尔·阿尔瓦雷斯。

;

;与以色列外交部联合组织这次旅行的以色列民间社会团体的发言人表示，这些旅行是为了由私人捐款资助的活动和活动也将于未来几天在布鲁塞尔、哥本哈根、海牙、维也纳和柏林举行。

;

;在马德里，家属敦促政府鼓励少数国家与他们直接接触哈马斯敦促释放人质。

;

;尤利·本·阿米 (Yulie Ben-Ami) 的父母奥哈德 (Ohad) 和拉兹 (Raz) 在以色列南部的贝里基布兹 (Be'eri Kibbutz) 被绑架。尤利·本·阿米 (Yulie Ben-Ami) 表示，他们面临严重危险，但“没有做错任何事”。

;

;“这里有孩子，还有80岁以上的老人。他们不应该遭受这样的痛苦，他们不应该受到责备，”她说。

;

;约有222人年龄从9个月到80岁不等。哈马斯杀害 1,400 人的袭击事件发生后，85 年间被扣为人质。

;

;;据信人质;藏在加沙地带，可能藏在哈马斯在那里修建的密集隧道中。

;

;哈马斯控制的加沙地带的卫生官员表示自以色列开始轰炸行动以来，已有 7,000 多人丧生。

;

;哈马斯周四表示，估计有 50 名哈马斯俘虏在以色列对加沙的袭击中丧生。路透社无法核实这些数字。

;

;周四，以色列表示，其地面部队连夜推进加沙，准备地面入侵。

;

;一些人质的家人< a href="/world/middle-east/hostage-families-face-appalling-dilemma-gaza-invasion-looms-2023-10-23/">;警告;这样的举动可能会让他们陷入进一步的危险。

;

;梅拉夫·莫尔·拉维夫（Merav Mor Raviv）的叔叔、婶婶、表弟和她九岁的儿子被绑架，她说她对如何解救人质没有意见：“我们不是政治家或外交官。< /p>;

;“我不是那个必须为世界提供解决方案的人。我来这里是为了告诉你真相，而不是哈马斯在电视上向你展示的所有其他事情。”

;

;Maayan Sigal-Koren 说，她的母亲和她的伴侣以及其他三名亲戚在尼尔伊扎克被绑架。 ：“我想要我的母亲回来，我现在就想要她回来，我不关心其他任何事情。”

;

;Naama Weinberg 的表弟 Itai Svirsky 在他的父母被杀时被绑架。她质疑为什么红色克罗斯没有探访加沙地带的人质，检查他们的健康状况，为老年人提供药物，为婴儿提供尿布和配方奶粉。

;

;“全世界都看到了哈马斯所做的可怕事情，他们所有这些都在 Facebook、Telegram 上进行了现场直播，”她说。

;

;“我为任何受到双方伤害的受害者感到难过。它应该立即停止。”
